Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service at Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spamama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property two separate nights book ending a wedding we were attending in Napa Valley. I have stayed at other Kimpton hotels an was pleased with the generous government employee rate my husband received. The staff at the Monaco was excellent and always willing to help -- whether it was a change of room because we were initially booked directly in front of the business center or with various recommendations for breakfast or with the fastest directions. We aren't big drinkers, but we loved the evening wine reception the hotel offers. As a Kimpton Insider, I was given a $10 minibar allowance, a perk I think is quite generous. The rooms were well appointed and the bathrooms sparkling and filled with lovely toiletries. We aren't hotel snobs but have stayed at such four-star hotels as the Four Seasons, the Ritz-Carlton, the Connaught in London, etc., and we thought the Kimpton staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in the centre of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: letsgo053
Reviews.Content: The Monaco is a very good hotel in the centre of San Francisco, close to Union Square. Comfortable beds, large bathroom, free internet (for Kimpton-members, which also gives you a 10 dollar credit for the minibar and a paper in front of your door everymorning. Complementary tea, coffee and cold lemon-water. And most important: kind staff at the reception. Great for exploring the beautiful city of San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Balanced choice for work and play”
Reviews.Author: tumbleweed55
Reviews.Content: As with many Kimptons, this hotel manages sucessfully to ease the business traveller into a more relaxed 'at home' state. Gym, chilled orange-infused water, low-light art deco w fireplaces galore, high ceilinged lobby with very W-hotelly music. Feels more like a welcoming base than most hotels, though for a price and with that veneer of charged friendliness you may or may not be up for after a full day of meetings. It's like they know they have a good thing and expect you to be more impressed than you are. Echo the comments on nice free wine reception, overworked masseuse (please tip folks, esp Europeans!), superb beds and great location. Rooms are very small, yes, but this never puts me off. Very cosy, well thought-out and retreat-like with canopy beds all pillowed up. Jogging in the morning and turning left instead of right was a proper shock (Tenderloin outskirts) but a few locals ended up running along with me with their liquids and we had a laugh. Basically, it's not as bad as other reviewers suggest, but stay right for upmarketness and general shopping/pop-art/diner mainstream fun. Speaking of, shopping-hungry Brits should head to DSW down the street for the craziest shoe bargains ever. Lovely walk down to the piers, and union square has all you'll need. All in all, a good balanced choice for work and play. There are better hotels in SF for only one or the other, but for location, perks, ease and bed comfort, this one's very good indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mamasix
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed in San Francisco before and I was a little worried about getting around the city. But the Hotel Monaco is in such a great location we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Dining, shopping, theatres...5 minute walk. The hotel itself is very clean. The rooms are spacious and very modern. I have to admit it's a little pricy, but I'm not used to paying San Francisco prices. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “sweet!!”
Reviews.Author: Sofiajclow
Reviews.Content: good hotel, service with a smile. hotel room not spacious but sweet and romantic. every evening wine tasting 5 - 6 and free 15mins shoulder massage, though never even got a chance to experiment it cos never can make it back in time from meetings. Happy hour with osyter $1 per piece was a great bargain. With free breakfast thrown in for the price, and free internet h if u r a kimpton member, a big yes from me on this hotel. Of course at near $200 a night its abit pricey but will take this anytime over hotel nikko i stayed in few weeks ago. The front desk and conceirge/butler were fabulous service. Downside is the room service that we need to pay a extra charge of $5 for delivering room service (a pizza of $6/- plus 21% tax, $5/- , then personal tips all come to over $43 for a $6 pizza is a bit steep. For the complimentary breakfast, i missed out 3 morning out of 5 of my stayed. The timing cud be more flexible and would be nice if they provide room service for the complimentary breakfast as its only croissant/pastry with coffee and orange juice.. Really hated having to get up just just for that. Will i go back again, yep, if they have a promotion for price to be less steep.. Parking also above $50 a day, cheaper at the corner $30 a day. Location .. good. The bed,,, mmmm i had backache after sleeping on their bed.. which i didnt when i was at hotel nikko. But im not sure cos i been travelling too much or just their mattress. oh and they give complimentary $10 for mini bar. and a free drink for happy hour. Great benefits for sure this hotel, little little things that make us guests and biz traveller smile .

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS AMAZING HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with the most amazing design that helps to let your own imagination flow!!!

Reviews.Title: “All That It Promised To Be”
Reviews.Author: getmeoutoftherain
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a junior suite for 3 nights in the middle of March. I was very happy with everything from the check in to the check-out. I requested a junior suite off of the street but when we saw the room, were not pleased. The front desk gave us a choice of a couple of other suites, and we chose one on the 6th floor, looking out to the street. I thought we would hear a lot of street noise, but with the exception of a few sirens on St Patrick's Day night (tons of parties in the town), it was quiet. The suite was smaller than the one in the Hotel Monaco in Portland, but was certainly enough room. The bed was comfortable, the dark out curtains allowed for a nice, dark room at night. I liked the pillows provided. Perhaps at one point I put the type of pillow we liked down in a profile, as they were perfect. Good heat/cooling system. The room could be made a perfect temperature. The windows actually open, so if you want fresh air ..it's there. The bathroom vanity was bit small. Limited counter space. Aveda bath products and plenty of complimentary items if you need anything. Just call the front desk. Perhaps we were in a ADA room, but the shower head was on a wand that could be moved up and down in the pipe (can't remember the name of that). Not a problem for me, but my husband is very tall, so he needed to hold the shower wand and could just stand under it. There were rails in the tub, and it was a low tub. Not a worry to us. Plenty of towels and pretty good thick, although I have had better in other hotels. WiFi was excellent. Free if you join the In Touch program. Many hotels in the area charge about $15/day for wifi. We used the fitness room, steam and hot tub. Fitness room was good, but small. Equipment good...two ellipticals, two treadmills, two recumbant bikes and one stair climber. Small collection of free weights, ball, bosu ball and some cords. Lobby always had fresh water, with either cucumbers or oranges. Every night was a wine reception. I thought it might have local wine, but was disappointed to see Little Penguin being served (Australia). Coffee, tea and hot chocolate available in the lobbby in the morning. If you want Starbucks, it's a block down the street. yes, Hotel Monaco is on the edge of the Tenderloin, so don't go left when you leave the building if you don't want to see reality. We took BART from the airport, bused , cable car'd, walked and took one cab while in San Francisco. You do not need a car if you plan to stay in the city, so the parking cost should not be a concern. Recommendations from the front desk for places to eat, were always good. They seem to know the places to go. We did not think the service in the Grand Cafe was efficient and we did not like the food. I would recommend this hotel. When I return though, I want to try one of the other KImpton properties.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and it was awesome. The staff was friendly, the location was good, and the whole place was just classy. I failed to request a goldfish in our room which I'm sad about but next time i'll make it happen. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!!”
Reviews.Author: suzysw
Reviews.Content: My 21 yrs old daughther and I spent two nights here. Very nice hotel, some rooms are small but it is very clean and very nice. if you sign up for their loyalty program you get free Wi-Fi, free coffee in the morning, free wine from 5-6pm,$10.00 free mini-bar stuff. The staff was very helpful and friendly. good location near Union Square... I would definitly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: afbostonguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is staffed with exceptionally friendly people - every person I encountered from the front desk to the hallways went out of their way to smile and greet me. The room is typical of a boutique hotel - a little on the smaller side (although not really that small for San Francisco) and well-appointed. The location is not great. It's certainly safe but it's a little walk to Market Street either via the not-great area or via the super tourist area. Check in and out were extremely quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but no coffee maker in the room is a deal breaker”
Reviews.Author: gbok357
Reviews.Content: Lovely and clean room, quiet floor, helpful people, nice exercise space, lovely lobby with fireplace to look at. Room service starts on the late side, and is expensive, so the best way to get a cup was to stumble down to the lobby where it is on offer. Made for a very inefficient morning! If you aren't a coffee hound, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: NGuilford
Reviews.Content: Location near Union Square is great and it has an interesting but quirky decorating scheme - the opposite of neutral beiges. But the other amenities were barely adequate: the towels were rough and nearly thread bare; the complimentary wine in the lobby between 5-6 was jug quality; the in-house bistro was barely adequate (several orders had to be sent back) and expensive. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Kimpton, but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: DallasJD6189
Reviews.Content: This has been my least favorite Kimpton hotel. The service was great and very friendly. The location was good. The noise level was very good in that we did not hear a lot of the door slamming and talking in most hotels. I just did not care for the overall style of the hotel. Just appeared dated and bordered on tacky. Fixtures looked weathered as if they have been untouched for years. I like their other more modern hotels like Ink 48 and Eventi in New York. There is such a thing as too much for room decor. I am sure others will find it charming, just not our cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LeahL1010
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to California, my husband and I stayed here for one night en route to Napa. Being part of the Kimpton chain, the hotel was decorated in a fun and unique fashion. The hotel is conveniently located and easily within walking distance to many attractions/stores/restaurants. Be aware though that it is on the fringe of a slightly sketchy neighbouhood, so be careful to head in the right direction if out for a stroll. Our room - a standard - was on the small side, but completely adequate for our one evening stay. Fun printed robes, Aveda bath products, and an extensive list of extras that the hotel will provide free of charge upon request (flat iron, curling iron, plastic bags for liquids) were notable extras. We attended the wine reception and enjoyed a glass while waiting for our cab to dinner - a great way to start our evening. We were also impressed with the concierge service that provided us with two excellent recommendations for lunch and breakfast. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “fun and quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early February, and had a great time. We were celebrating our anniversary, and were asked at the front desk at check in about our trip. We came back after touring later in the day to find a bottle of wine chilling in our room. We also enjoyed the wine reception one evening. The room are quirky and different from any we've stayed in, colorful and fun. The hotel restaurant is gorgeous - at least have breakfast there. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. We were on a high floor, so the room was quiet. Easy walk to union square. Don't hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “A nice winsome touch to a biz trip”
Reviews.Author: jantsk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Hotel Monaco in Salt Lake City a few years ago and decided to stay in it again for my recent trip to SF. Just as quirky and delightful. The fireplace is great, and lounge decor, interesting. The concierge was extremely helpful with my group transport arrangements. Reception staff service varied, depending on the individual...I would say of 3 staff/nights, 1 was exceptional, and 2 were average.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: drisSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in San Francisco for a quick overnight visit. The Hotel Monaco was chosen for its proximity to Union Square (2 block away) and because it is part of the Kimpton Hotel chain. I have always had good experiences at their other hotels in San Francisco and Boston, so I thought I'd give this one a try. This hotel is quirky, with an interesting French bistro downstairs, and a slightly out of the way location (2 blocks from Union Square can feel very different than Union Square), but I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff was very pleasant, room service was fast and delicious, the room was cozy and quiet, the drive to the airport in the hotel car was calm and relaxing. All in all, I was very satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Review from a Kimpton Fan”
Reviews.Author: BobofNewtn
Reviews.Content: On the occasion of our first visit to San Francisco, We opted to follow the Kimpton brand and book a suite (624) for our three day stay. The Monaco is a stately property that houses a very friendly staff and has updated and meticulously clean rooms. We cannot think of one negative thing to report and we would return in the future without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Style and smiles make this a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Therapist
Reviews.Content: I can't add much to the other reviews, other than to say that the staff were the most friendly I've had at a hotel in San Francisco, the property was stylish and the rooms were most comfortable. The hotel was a great place to hang out after a day full of activities. The one negative would be the location - it is a block away from some pretty shady action in the tenderloin. Still, I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprize”
Reviews.Author: Gary J
Reviews.Content: We had never been to SF or a Klimpton property but we are sure to do both again, Klimpton was wonderful from a nice clean room to wine reception each night to wonderful friendly service from every employee at the Hotel. Klimpton is on the top of our list of Hotels to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “mong the best in SF”
Reviews.Author: USATravelDC
Reviews.Content: I love Kimptons. The service is impeccable and the rooms are renovated on a frequent basis. This hotel is located near Union Square and accessible to the BART and MUNI trains. Like other hotels in the chain, they take care of customers with everything from complimentary copies of the Sunday NYT (normal cost $6 a pop), wine and cheese reception in the afternoon and phenomenally decorated rooms. I got a great rate and by joining their club you get a $10 coupon in the mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Online
Reviews.Content: Whenever my partner and I want a night or weekend away for a staycation - we head to the Monaco. Great staff, terrific Spa, wonderful restaurant and bar, and very comfortable. And if you want a goldfish for the night - you got it. At the nightly wine hour (5-6pm) in the ground floor living room, we've met many people who repeatedly stay at the Monaco, as well as other locals who also love to stay there. We have stayed in every offering of the guest rooms and suites and have found every one comfortable and spacious. The Mediterranean suites are on the building corners with views of both sides. The Monaco is located just a couple blocks away from Union Square and Market St. - great location for easy walking to all the great stores and a short walk to Muni and BART train lines. We enjoy after dinner drinks at the Grand Cafe bar and the weekend live music. And sitting in front of the fireplace in one of the living rooms off the lobby enjoying some wine and conversation and people watching as people walk by on the street sidewalks. The Grand Cafe restaurant is one of our favorites and have been going to it for close to 20 years. Though I no longer have a dog, it is great that others do bring their dogs and that they can stay at the hotel. It is always fun when someone's dog is hanging out behind the lobby desk while they are out about the city. Great staff and service, and very comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in SF, you need to check it out”
Reviews.Author: Texasguyandgal
Reviews.Content: SF has great places to stay, but normally it is good location, expensive, but it is SF. Well, we found an alternative. The Hotel Monaco is a Kimpton property and one of probably six in SF and truly a European boutique hotel, close to Union Square and very inexpensive, try a junior suite for $230/night. Wonderful staff, they honestly got to know you and made you feel so welcome. Oh, their food is excellent as well. Our friends who stayed at the Four Seasons were jealous and came to our hotel for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but nice”
Reviews.Author: perfectpillow
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in an excellent location, close to shops, BART and cable car. Took advantage of the complementary continental breakfast, so can't vouch for the food, but bar was always full of early evening diners downing seafood and cocktails etc. Kimpton Hotel, so signing on to the newsletter gets you free WiFi in your room - a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, attentive service”
Reviews.Author: docankle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention. It was a pleasant walk through union square to the moscone center. My queen room was cozy, but very comfortable and clean. My room faced the interior so it was very quiet. Free Wifi as a Kimpton member worked great and the $10 mini-bar voucher was handy as I would never otherwise even open it. Workout room was nice, too, with 3 ellipticals, treadmills, and weights. Morning coffee was pleasant and the wine hour was also a nice touch with free seated massage service. Lots of great food and shopping within a short walking distance. It is at the edge of the "good" area around Union Square but I never felt unsafe. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay when in SF”
Reviews.Author: Vacation_addicted
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three day stay at the Monaco Kimpton in SF. The hotel is very centrally located, near Union Square, lots of restaurants and theaters. It has a special flair, very European and we enjoyed that it also has a restaurant on site. The staff is kind and attentive. The reason I did not give it "Excellent" is that there were a few let downs. I had contacted the hotel before the visit three times to stress the importance of a quiet room. I know the hotel is located down town and in a big city, but I had heard that it has rooms back to the courtyard which are very quiet. I am also a Kimpton Intouch member where I also stated that I require a quiet room. My husband is in the Military and it is very important to us as surprising noises, like sirens can stress him. We were given a room on the 7th floor, which is their highest floor, but to the street side. We came well equipped with a white noise maker, and putting the in room fan on, but there was still a lot of outside noise. My husband was ok with it that's why I left it alone. The second night they put a family with a dog in the next room and he barked a few times, but overall it was ok. I just think that if somebody calls and mentions that they need a quiet room and also stresses the reason for military, the hotel should have tried their best to accommodate us. The room was also very small. We had a desk on one side of the bed, but the other side had not even a nightstand. As you are most of the time out and about we did not mind the size, but if I would stay longer then a weekend I think it would be a problem. As a Kimpton Intouch member you get free WiFi, a free Newspaper to your door, $10 discount on the mini bar and $30 of the Spa. We also had breakfast included, which was a Continental breakfast at the restaurant, containing of coffee, juice , fruit and a pastries. On check in we had to remind them that we had the booking including breakfast to get the coupon as well as that one gets a Newspaper as a member. If you come with your car park on Jones street. They have a over night parking for $20 a day instead of the $50+ rate at the hotel. Overall I would come and stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Saratogajh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made our first non-business trip to SF. The Hotel Monaco was our chioice based on prior visits to sister property in Portland. We were not disappointed. Location excellent. Easy walk to Union Square, BART, Chinatown. We even walked to Wharf. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Service was outstanding. Coffee service available in room and lobby. Evening wine reception at 5:00 pm. Complimentary chair massage! We arrived via air and BART, but noticed pricey overnight valet parking ($50). Highly recommend the Hotel Monaco SF.

Reviews.Title: “We had a rocky start here, but ended up loving it.”
Reviews.Author: jenkins_2004
Reviews.Content: We arrived in mid-afternoon with others from our company. Others were quickly shown to their rooms but we had a king, and were told it wasn'g ready yet. We had a late lunch and when we returned, it still wasn't ready yet. At first they offered to switch us to a queen room, but we had paid for a king, I wasn't budging. However, finally around 4:30 when the room still wasn't ready, they offered us an upgrade which we took. The junior suite was excellent and made our stay wonderful. We got a discount on a spa treatment which I took advantage of. The room was lovely and the bedding was very comfortable. We really enjoyed it. The massage I got was extraordinary! The workout room was well equipped and pleasant. The sauna and steam room were great as well. Didn't try out the whirlpool but it looked fine. We ate in the Grand Cafe (hotel restaurant) and my dinner (sirlon) was very good but others in our party were disappointed with the cassoulet. We all enjoyed the wine hour with snacks. It was a great place to rewind. Unlike other wine offerings at hotel, the Hotel Monaco had enough seating for folks to stay through the hour. It was a lot of fun. I also enjoyed the Aveda products in the bathroom, the provided terry robes, umbrellas and the free NYTimes and other newspapers available in the morning along with coffee and tea. We really enjoyed our stay, after a rocky start, but it proved to be a blessing to get the upgrade. I'd definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small version of a European 'Grande Dame' of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a number of times although this is my first review of the place. Ideally located a few blocks from Union Square, the hotel is well placed for business or leisure. Kimpton (Owners) often do deals and I managed to secure a good room at a good price. Although perhaps a little small, my room was well proportioned with all ameneties plus quality soaps etc. The whole place has a very European feel about it which I enjoyed - not the usual stuff served up in the US. Reception was efficient as was room service (try the onion soup...delicious!). This is all well complemented by the Grand Cafe, an art-deco masterpiece of a restaurant on the ground floor. Great breakfasts served up - try the Roast Chicken Hash, unusual and tasty. In summary, if you are looking for a touch of old fashioned luxury in a great city, try the Hotel Monaco.........especially if you can secure a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: stateofgrace-montana
Reviews.Content: Kimpton has it figured out. I have stayed at numerous Kimpton properties around the country and they always meet or exceed expectations. SF Monaco is no exception. Close to everything you would want to do in downtown SF without having to drive. Staff is very cordial and helpful and seem to always go the extra mile. Rooms are very clean and very eclectic with bold approach to mixing colors and stripes. Did not get a chance to eat in the restaurant so can't advise there. Only complaint is the cost for valet parking, $50 a nite unless you have a full size SUV then it's $65. Nevertheless very much enjoyed our weekend stay at the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at The Monaco”
Reviews.Author: DomVersyn
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at the hotel Monaco in Jan/Feb. 2012. I Flew from France to visit the city and this hotel was a perfect place to stay. The staff is really nice and helpful, they provided us with all the information we needed. The hotel lobby is very nicely decorated, with great services such as free coffee in the morning and wine tasting at evenings by the fireplace. We had a room on the 7th floor. As requested at booking, it was calm and I've got to say it features one of the best beds I've had in hotel rooms ever. However small the room was very convenient with a lot of amenities and a very well stocked minibar. As a Kimpton intouch member, I had a complimentary $10 voucher at the minibar which was nice. The fitness area is quite well equipped and the sauna/jacuzzi and steam room are so enjoyable after a day of sightseeing. Well, a very positive review for an hotel where we'll be definitely back.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and fun stay”
Reviews.Author: MsRCY
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful one night stay in a deluxe queen room on the 6th floor. Furnishings were fun and romantic, the bed was comfortable, and loved the amenities (free wifi and $10 minibar credit with Kimpton membership program, cucumber and orange water in the lobby, and coffee/tea service in the morning). Didn't hear any street or neighbor noise from the room. Staff were incredibly friendly and I wish we could've stayed longer (and tried the sauna!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillBrowns
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding. I stayed here with business in November 2011. I would come back with the family if they can do good rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, super design, very unique atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: toysforboys
Reviews.Content: Stayed second time for three night. The room was acceptable in size; excellent in design- just unique not like a chain, and very quiet considering the location. Having a sauna and fitness room in the middle of SF is also a great plus. If you chose to come with your car, do not use the valet. You can park in three minutes walking distance next to Dottieâ€™s True Blue CafÃ© for a fraction of the price. Join Kimptonâ€™s loyalty program for free internet. And we loved the atmosphere this hotel has, starting with the bellman, the wine tasting, and last not least the dog at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very colorful, spacious room and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: EnaTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed her during a work trip with a colleague and enjoyed the overall experience. I had to blink a couple of times upon entering the room: wow,very colorful and lots of stripes. I like quirky hotels though and it was a pleasure to stay in a more unique setting. I found the bed to be a little bit too soft for my liking and the blanket too thin, but the latter was quickly fixed with an extra blanket. Our television was not working properly when we arrived, but this was taken care of as soon as we mentioned it at the front desk and we found a friendly apologetic note and some treats upon our return. Loved the complimentary happy hour downstairs from 5-6 pm. Great way to unwind with a glass of wine after some long days at a trade show. Friendly staff. Overall very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: Ugy H
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Kimptons before and generally all were excellent. This one however needs a bit of freshening up- room a bit tired looking-carpets a bit stained- bed mattress so soft and saggy we needed to ask for a board - room great size- upgraded us and staff very accommodating- great location for center of town and parking special a good deal-we were told that rooms were going to be redone- so when that happens an A+

Reviews.Title: “Another winner from Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: funnygirl1
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is a great city to visit anytime but Christmas time in the city is wonderful. In the past we have visited before Christmas but this time decided to actually spend the holiday there. Our other stays have been at the Hotel Palomar which we really enjoy but this time we decided to change things up and chose the Hotel Monaco. My first thought was that the neighborhood seemed a little more rough around the edges but not unsafe. It is actually very convenient as there is a Walgreens and small market across the street. There is also a restaurant at the hotel but I can't say much since we only had a continental breakfast there. Prior to our arrival my husband had talked and emailed with Francess regarding restaurants that would be serving Christmas dinner. She was very helpful in providing us with a list of restaurants. She was also kind enough to upgrade us to a Monaco suite. Our room was located on the 7th floor and was very nice with a good sized sitting room with a small sofa, coffee table, two chairs, two end tables, a desk & chair and an armoire that held the mini bar and TV., The bedroom had a king bed, two nightstands, a desk & chair and TV and was not uncomfortably cramped. The bathroom was exceptionally large and included a jacuzzi tub. Overall a very nice, very clean room. After check-in we went out to grab lunch and do some shopping. Upon our return we were delighted to find a bottle of wine and a bowl of chocolates compliments of the hotel guest relations manager. A very nice touch. As you may or may not know, Kimpton hotels offer a complimentary wine hour. At the Monaco there is an absolutely beautiful "living room" next to the front desk where they had a fire in the fireplace and complimentary chair massage during happy hour. Between the Palomar and the Monaco I would say the Monaco is much more beautiful and grand with it's painted ceilings and gorgeous woodwork. I can't say enough about the staff and how helpful they were or how comfortable they made us feel. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in spite of the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tarheel08
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, the neighborhood immediately surrounding this hotel is not great. However, the hotel itself has a very welcoming, safe feel. We had a Junior Suite which is spacious for two but is not big enough to really qualify as a suite. Also, the hotel is in an older building which means there are some limitations to the room design. Our room also showed signs of wear and tear but was spotlessly clean. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, something we definitely appreciate about Kimpton hotels. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: MikeRea
Reviews.Content: Here on business for 4 nights, booked a Junior Suite thinking that it might allow meetings. First thing noticed: a suite just means there is a sofa in the room, not that there are two rooms... Major thing is just how noisy it is. Geary is a busy street - lots of cars at all hours of the night, and about a fifth of them have noisy exhausts. The double glazing seems to cut out none of it. Added to that a UK city level of passers by in the street (there are a good bunch of 'street locals' and/or homeless in the blocks around) who don't mind making as much noise as they want. Again, the double glazing has no effect. On this third floor room, there is rumbling all night - sounds like trams/ subway, but who knows... This part of Geary is right at the end of where San Francisco seems upmarket, and right where it turns downmarket (massage parlours, etc.). All that said, the Grand CafÃ© is excellent for breakfast and brunch, and the hotel staff are really helpful. It just doesn't lead to a restful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wallaby_tour
Reviews.Content: Well located to shops and museums. We booked the hotel based on reviews on trip advisor and despite a couple of issues were not disappointed. Having made the booking we discovered a few nights before checking in that the same room was available for a significantly lower rate. We contacted the hotel and were upgraded to a suite and charged below the original quoted rate, so were happy with the hotel's response. We then had a problem with an overflowing toilet which when reported to the staff was quickly addressed and fixed. Only complaint with the suite (Mediterreanean) was that the sofa bed was very uncomfortable for our teenage son - had to result in moving the mattress on to the floor to avoid the bar in the bed, so suite is really only good for 2 adults and maybe a child.

Reviews.Title: “If You Don't Mind the Street-Locals, a Gem of a Choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: UrbanNomadinLA
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that one's first impression might be sketchy, after being welcomed to Skid Row by the locals, the Monaco is well situated just two blocks from Union Square, some of the world's best shopping, theaters and terrific restaurants. The Monaco is a little gem, actually. We had a small suite, with a lovely King bed, Frette sheets, cozy animal print bathrobes, pull-out couch for our 8 year old son in a small living room. The striped wallpaper and lovely red cotton flour-de-lys patterned curtains made the room feel very upscale yet warm and comforting. Each afternoon at 5pm the hotel provided a lovely cocktail hour in the lounge off the lobby, complete with masseuse, Wii for the kids, and a selection of wines and non-alcoholic spirits. A roaring fire (albeit gas) added to the holiday feel. On the not-so-great-side, the floors are not clean. The beautiful rugs in the lobby are noticecibly dirty; the carpets on the upper floors are quite stained. But other than that, the service was very good; all the attendants were attentive and proactive at making your stay as nice as possible. The restaurant is divine, whether for a meal or for happy hour where oysters are $1 a piece, weekdays. The overall experience is at once very French and very cosmopolitan with a Zen-like feel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great classic hotel but no tea/coffee facility”
Reviews.Author: archiescat
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for four nights in a perfect location on Geary St so close to shops and Union Square. It made our stay in SF memorable and cosy. The only disappointment was no tea or coffee facilities for evening or afternoons. I see other reviewers were bold enough to request this but we had no idea that we could. The dining room is a classic art deco experience with beautiful food and attentive staff. Breakfasts and dinners were a real treat. We would highly recommend this hotel even with its oddities like goldfish delivered to your room if you are lonely. A world class hotel if they can fix the tea-coffee issue.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: WWWandLBOC
Reviews.Content: Upscale but unpretentious, and not so large as to be overwhelming. Stayed in a double queen bed room with stylish French decor. The spacious bathroom was particularly nice. The only *very* minor problem I had was that the check-in clerk forgot to give me a key to the minibar, which I had hoped to use for cold storage (rectified without issue). Otherwise no complaints. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Lovers Dream Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Puppeylove
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and our two yellow labs just spent 2 wonderful nights at this great hotel, and highly recommend it to anyone who is looking to visit the City and bring along their dogs (what we called a "petcation"). We live only 1 1/2 hours away from San Francisco, but my husband surprised me with a birthday getaway, with our four legged kids. People Accommodations: - From the moment we checked into the hotel, every time we passed through the front entrance, and even when we checked out, the staff greeted us so genuinely and almost always by name (how they all knew us I'll never know). - The hotel was beautifully decorated for the season and had several lounge areas to hang out and socialize with other guests, who were all very friendly to both us and the dogs. - The room was a good size, spotless and very chic/cute. - The bed was SO comfortable! - We were on the side of the hotel that was off of Geary and we did not hear a sound, except 2 police sirens, and a barking dog for a short while, who was down the hall on the last night. - We ordered room service which was quick, affordable and delicious. Pet Accommodations: - The location of the hotel with our pets was fantastic! - My husband read that the hotel provided dog beds and dog bowls, so we did not bring any, and called the front desk to request some. While it was not a problem to have them brought up to our room, I think bringing their own bowls would have been easier and better for them (even though they were very nice round dog beds and nice brand new metal bowls). - When we arrived the very sweet girl that checked us in (I wish I were as good at remembering names) recommended Boudin Bakery, which was a short walking distance away, and allowed us to eat outside with the dogs (the clam chowder bread bowls were wonderful). - The next two days we drove to Ocean Beach, which was about 20 min away, and is a place that allows dogs to run and play off leash. The beach was clean, went on for miles, and everyone we ran into had dogs playing, and couldn't have been friendlier. There is even a really good restaurant right across the street called Park Chalet, which allows you to eat outside with your pets. - Union Square is the closest place for a grassy potty location, and is only 2 or 3 blocks away, right down the street. It felt like a safe walk there, even at 4:30am. We did pass a few homeless people on the way but they either kept to themselves or just said "happy holidays". Note, there is a park on California Street, which is about 7 blocks away, uphill the entire way, and is a major workout. - Note: Our dogs had never stayed in a hotel before, so taking the elevator to the 7th floor was a learning experience. They were scared for about the first day and a half, but were ok with it by the time we left. Thank you Hotel Monaco for allowing pets into your wonderful establishment, and for helping to make this one of the best birthday's ever!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: mdb2005
Reviews.Content: We just recently wrapped up a five day, four night stay at Hotel Monaco. The hotel was quite charming, with a great wine bar at night and coffee bar in the morning....make sure to attend both! The location is right on the edge of what I would call the perfect location. Three block walk to Union square where you can pick up the cable car line as well as many double decker tour buses. Nob hill is just a few block walk up Taylor street and is great. I do not recommend waking south of the hotel as the neighborhood transitions pretty quickly from good to sketchy. But as long as you stay north you will be in walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, Nob Hill, etc. The hotel staff is great and the rooms are very charming. We would stay here again. I was very glad we did NOT stay by Fisherman's Wharf as that location is extremely touristy and crowded. I recommend checking out Alcatraz (book your tickets EARLY), Muir Woods, Sausilito, Napa Valley, Chinatown, Fisherman's wharf and the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Everything Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: ToodieD
Reviews.Content: Our annual Holiday Trek to San Francisco: Window shopping, eating in the City's great restaurants, watching the ice skaters on the rink in Union Square, shopping for the perfect tree ornament at Gumps . . . This year we stayed at the Hotel Monaco. This is a Kimpton property which consistently means excellent service, unique boutique hotels, and great locations. The Monaco is no exception. The lobby is a delight--they just don't make them like this anymore. Service from valet parking to check-in was perfect. Our room, though small, was stylishly furnished and appointed. The bed was perfect. We loved our stay at this sweet little hotel--likely to become the hotel for us when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: pjalmtlansing
Reviews.Content: Really attentive and helpful staff. Every question we had was addressed. Good location and plenty of taxis. Walking to Union Square and Chinatown was easy. Coffee and a coffee maker was brought to our room on request, otherwise coffee was served in the lobby. Exceptional attitudes and helpfulness from employees. Clean and comfortable. Free internet if you join Kimpton's club.

Reviews.Title: “the best ever”
Reviews.Author: sue5153
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very close to lots of things including shopping trolly buses and other transport lots of eating places around and in the hotel its self we have stayed in lots of hotels around the world but this one has got to be the best mainly due to the staff all the staff they are always willing to help with any questions you may have the rooms are really nice with plenty of space the coffee and tea are free in the morning and they have free wine in the evenings not sure about the times as didnt go to busy going places. there is quite alot of down and outs in the area which i thought would be a problem but not at all didnt bother us one bit even late at night simply cannot say enough about how good this hotel is it is in downtown san francisco make sure you book this one as there is one in china town to

Reviews.Title: “â€œDoggies reign at this Kimpton quality propertyâ€�”
Reviews.Author: 1happytraveler12
Reviews.Content: Kimpton's Palomar L.A. Westwood set the property standard for me. I stayed at Monaco years ago, and recent negative reviews made me concerned this property had deteriorated. Not so. From arrival to departure, my yorkie and I experienced excellent service (starting with a yummy c-o-o-k-i-e). We stayed here for two weeks due to construction at home. After a sleepless night in a queen room, due to a noisy guest on the other side of a connecting door, I was upgraded to a king suite. The wireless internet worked perfectly. I am an In-Touch member, so no charge for internet (hotels that charge make a mistake). Our top-floor windows faced the street, and there was noise from police/fire sirens during the night, but it was less disturbing than the noisy guest in our prior connecting room! The bed was a bit firm, probably because I don't weigh much so prefer softer mattresses. I like the white duvet covers (and no potentially nasty "bedspreads"). The bathroom lighting needs to be improved. It is dim, because of the politically correct dim fluorescent bulbs. One small imperfection-I never did get my newspaper delivery; but if one gets downstairs early enough, the hotel has stacks of three popular papers available. I was comfortable with the bright, eclectic decor. The room was in very good shape, the shower was good. The rooms/suites are smaller than Palomar Westwood (different market). High quality ("George") doggy bowls and bed were delivered, and my lil guy was treated like a prince. I forgot to bring his food the first day, and the lovely petite young lady at the front desk, Francis, saved the day by giving him a cache of cookies. The wine-hour opportunity to socialize with other guests around the fireplace is a really nice feature, and it was my dog's favorite time (so many opportunities to show off). Several evenings, samples of the restaurant's flatbreads were served. Every member of the staff offered excellent service. In addition to Francis, Jonathan stands out, but that is not to say that anyone under-performed (I simply don't remember the names). Housekeeping was excellent. The carpeting in the living room looks somewhat worn (probably stained by wine spills), but that room is an inviting place to relax. The very good morning coffee got me out to walk the dog. I checked out the fitness area but hadn't brought attire; it was adequate for any workout. The restaurant used to be a favorite. It is not as good as it used to be, and I don't find the menu as appealing. It is not as good as the Palomar Westwood, which is very good. The location is surrounded by aggressive bums. Too bad. Guests need to know not to walk in certain directions. However, overall, this property lives up to the Kimpton standard.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in 3 years in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: TGibb0710
Reviews.Content: I had been traveling to San Francisco every two weeks for two years since 2009. I usually stayed at Hyatt hotels and never bothered branching out. I decided to stay at the Hotel Monaco in January of 2011. I loved it so much I never left until December of 2011 (I also had to stay in San Francisco to work all year). The hotel itself is beautiful and cozy, the hotel amenities are outstanding, especially the jacuzzi and sauna and the wine hour at 5 p.m. The rooms are spacious for San Francisco and I never was troubled by noise from next door. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. But the reason I will always choose the Monaco is the people. By the end of my stay I actually was sad to leave. The entire staff is friendly and makes a sincere effort to make your stay an enjoyable one. The hotel and its staff are above and beyond what most are used to, even at other 4 star hotels. I'll never stay anywhere else again in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: LKayD
Reviews.Content: On our recent visit we encountered an exceptional employee at the reception desk, enjoyed the complimentary wine reception, relaxed in the spa, and stopped by the water station offering fresh fruit and vegetable flavored water. All staff made us and our dog feel at home. We have stayed here many times over the years and have never had a bad stay. Sign up for InTouch so the staff can cater to your every wish, such as what kind of pillow you prefer. There is no extra charge for the InTouch perks.

Reviews.Title: “Fish”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: 5th or 6th time in San Francisco, 1st time at Hotel Monaco. Loved it. Exceptional staff - friendly, helpful efficient. Hotel is lovely, very good public spaces - particular the main lounge with fire, wine, coffee, cool music. My room would be small for two people but for just me it was fine. Well I say just me, I did in fact bring up a guest to my room for entire stay - a fish. Hotel offers a bowl with goldfish in for your room and on my bedside table he/she resided. French cafe rouge-type restaurant in the hotel was good enough with atmosphere. Hotel location is excellent - 2 blocks from Union Square, 4 blocks or so from shops in market street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJane10
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Monaco and had 5 great nights staying there on our first trip to San Francisco. It's in a good location, a few minutes walk from Union Square. The staff were incredibly helpful, knowledgeable and friendly...certainly 'above and beyond' what you expect or find at most hotels. Every evening between 5-6pm the hotel has an hour of complimentary wine tasting in their lounge which we took advantage of and was a great way to relax after a day of exploration before heading out later in the evening. They even had a Wii in the lounge that you could play on if you wanted. Another highlight was the gym/spa. The gym itself is what you'd expect but the spa was brilliant...a nice big hot tub, steam room and sauna in a very chilled setting. They were empty every time we used them, and again above the standard we'd expected, so a nice surprise! We had a junior suite as a room. It was a quirky style of decoration but we liked that and found the room very comfortable. The bathroom was maybe a little small and basic, but certainly didn't cause us any issues. This hotel is a gem and we couldn't recommend it highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Solegirl73
Reviews.Content: I was already impressed with the Hotel Monaco in Seattle, so I came to this SF location with a glad heart. I was not disappointed in any way with the service, decor, and location. The complimentary wine happy hour was in a cozy sitting room with a crackling fireplace, and the heavy hors d'oeurves were the perfect start to an evening before dinner. If the weather is nice, one should consider a jog to the ferry building. The view of the sunrise is spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Good times at Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: bkelley77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Monaco November 11-14th for a surprise weekend getaway for my husband. We love the hotel chain and usually try to stay at a Monaco if there is one in the city we are visiting, and San Francisco's version did not disappoint. We had the usual friendly and helpful staff, clean and up to date room, great location, all the works. The only compaint we had was the parking rate...$50 per night!? We're used to paying a big fee to park at a hotel lot but this just seemed exorbitant. Luckily we were tipped off about an adjacent lot that only charged $25 per night (seemed like a bargain in comparison) so we moved there after the first night. Otherwise we had no complaints about our stay and would definately there next time we visit, just wouldn't bring a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & charm with the Kimpton touch”
Reviews.Author: lkfreema
Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed at Hotel Monaco for a night, I had a really great stay at the hotel. It's in a great location, and I just love the charm of Kimpton Hotels. Dog bones in the lobby, animal print bath robes, gold fish behind the front desk. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms are a good size. The hotel is in a really great location. All staff members were extremely friendly. I really have no complaints and would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: Staff are very friendly and helpful. Fitness center is plenty big and nice. Wireless was great.....Morning coffee and paper were out early (I'm an early riser). Convenient to Union Sq and financial district (about a 10 min walk) , Chinatown Gate, etc. Would definitely recommend for biz travel or for a nice couples spot for a weekend in SFO.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: carolandmike
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel in good location. Charming interior. Happy hour with complimentary cocktails. Good beds, not too soft. Would recommend and go back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay”
Reviews.Author: phsavage
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. From the moment we stepped out of the taxi, and into the lobby the staff was great! I loved the room. It was a little funky, but still nice. The hotel is nicely located! Bed was comfy, and believe it or not we felt like the only guest there. We never heard other guest in their rooms, or staff loud in the hallways. Only when we were in the elevators, and in the lobby we seen and heard others. I was pretty happy about that, we have all stayed in hotels that you hear the damn showers, talking, and the staff all loud. I would recommend this place to anyone!!! I would stay here again forsure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Whobetterthanace414
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice bar, people that work there are nice, location is near all the fun locations bars, restaurants, trolleys, the only thing and Its not about the hotel but be warned as soon as you leave the hotel people called San francisco artists will ask you for money handouts, help. I live in Texas we call them homeless, drug addicts, scum smelly people. Thank Nancy pelosi your town needs real help, but the food 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “A Very Cool Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lost_gaucho
Reviews.Content: In October, we went to San Francisco for a couple's weekend and stayed at the Hotel Monaco. As soon as we entered the lobby, we could tell this was a unique place, with some art Noveau elements and great ambiance, without being stuffy. The staff was very friendly and informed us we should come back downstairs for the daily free wine tasting the hotel has every evening. What a treat! Guests would gather on an other room with comfortable seating and have their choice of white or red wine. They were willing to help us in anything we needed, offering to book shows for us, giving us the detailed maps of Chinatown with restaurant suggestions, and so on. The location is great, right in the theater district, about three blocks away from the Central Station (where you can catch the double decker tour buses that take you by every major attraction in the city) and couple more to Chinatown. It is near several cool art galleries for art lovers delight, selling original MirÃ³, Chagall and Picasso lithographs, even some selling Doctor Seuss' works. It also has a lot of bars and pubs nearby that seem to attract a lot of theater goers before/after plays, besides people that come into the neighborhood for that purpose. For our meals, we could either go to the hotel's French restaurant, in the same beautiful style and ambiance, or find great options nearby. There are a lot of breakfast restaurants, "diner style" to choose from nearby, if you prefer not to eat at the hotel. The rooms are good and the toiletries provided for guests were high quality. Notice the funky zebra robes for the guests use hanging in the closets, a nice change from the white ones usually offered at other places, but totally fitting this hotel experience. The hotel also has a gym and spa, but we were too busy exploring the city and had short time there, however if we go back to San Fran we would gladly come back to the same hotel and maybe then check the spa out. Highly recommended for couples and people that want something unique and tasteful combined with comfort and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Not our style”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticJohn
Reviews.Content: Had booked this hotel for a couple of nights while visiting San Francisco with my wife. She hated it at first sight and immediately booked us elsewhere. It didn't even matter for her that we had to pay for the first night. I didn't find it so bad, the public spaces were very pleasant and nicely decorated, as well as the restaurant, which we tried. It also has the Kimpton kind of excentric touch, which is interesting. Problem is, the rooms are rather small and not so up to date. And most of all, the area around the hotel is shady and not so pleasant to walk about. Price is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: Riaaron
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into our hotel, we were greeted by a friendly bellman who directly showed us to the front desk. Checking in and checking out of the hotel was nice and quick. We happened to arrive during a happy hour event in which the hotel was offering both complimentary 5 minute massages and red wine - this was much needed after an hour long drive from the South Bay. Don't miss the hotel's happy hour event (5-6pm) as it is a great way to start the evening in the city off right.The decor of the hotel and its rooms were very eclectic with pin stripe walls, a canopy hovering over the bed, oversized mirrors, plush chairs and couches, a beautiful marble staircase - every detail and furniture of the hotel was superb, and comfortable to the touch. Speaking of comfort, Hotel Monaco beds are just that, in addition, the pillows were nice and extra soft. Although the rooms were small, this did not bother us at all. The only gripe about staying here was the running toilet in our room; we called to fix it but it wasn't completely fixed. Overall, our stay at Hotel Monaco was a fun and pleasant experience, we were impressed with everything the hotel had to offer and we would definitely come back again. One more thing, adjacent to the hotel is a restaurant called the Grand Cafe, they serve a delicious brunch menu, don't leave SF without eating there first. Parking tip: We recommend parking at the 24 hour parking garage right around the corner of the hotel, they charge $30, whereas the hotel charges about $50 for valet parking. Location: Walking distance to Union Square shopping area

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel. good location to union square.”
Reviews.Author: BevinDPT
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here one night. It was a night hotel. not exactly worth $314+ per night but comfortable beds. there is a parking garage near the hotel that is like $36 a day, which was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraceKelly97
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by the fun atmosphere of this hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is easy walking distance to many places as well as transit and the trolley cars which we hopped on to get around. This hotel definitely made are trip to San Francisco memorable. However, if you're looking for large, modern, airy rooms - this isn't the hotel for you. This place has character.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay for the theatre”
Reviews.Author: photomom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here and took in a play at the Curran Theatre, the next block over. We stayed in a suite and it was just right for the two of us. It has a kind of luxurious and kitschy design to the rooms but done well and the bed was completely comfortable. The bathroom was large and clean with a big shower, Aveda products and a Jacuzzi tub that worked perfectly. There was a conference that just came in, so the wine reception and the pre-theatre restaurant and bar was crowded, but after the play it was a great place to get a drink and a snack (cheese plate and a pizza marguerita). There are also other bars and restaurants in walking distance; we tried Bar Adagio and the drinks and service were fine. We did not get breakfast here, so no comment about that. I can see though, if we did not get a suite, the room would have been pretty small. The suite only cost us a little bit more with a AAA discount (also valet/overnight parking is about $50.00!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Newbondy
Reviews.Content: Solid Kimpton Hotel in a great location. The rooms are good with many extras to make you feel at home. The staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stripy wallpaper”
Reviews.Author: Iainofthestocks
Reviews.Content: Slightly wacky, couldn't fault much. Instant hot water in the evening would have been nice. Apart from that, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff are brilliant... but the rooms are pretty small”
Reviews.Author: M0nika81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based a lot on the recent reviews and whilst I absolutely agree that the staff are fantastic, the room itself was a little disappointing. The bed at a push was a double and the room would be a tight fit if there was two of you there! Location is great, but next time I would stay somewhere perhaps not so close to Union Square in the hope of getting a little more room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel a shame about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: anhemp
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. 6th visit to San Francisco and out of all the places ive stayed this was pretty the best located. 5 min walk or less to Union Square. Probably a 15 min walk to the ferry terminal. Staff were always helpful especially the doormen. Always asking us if we needed assistance with directions, transport etc. Room was very nice. Now the only disappointment was the breakfast. Free continental breakfast. We werent expecting much but all that was offered was fruit and pastries from memory and it was brought to your table by your waiter. If you wanted anything semi decent you had to order it at a cost. Not the end of the world but once we realised this was the case we werent going to get up and leave. If we knew there was a charge we would have gone to one of our many favourite cafes in SF which would have had a larger menu to choose from

Reviews.Title: “Nice, intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhapgood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco at the beginning of October. I was part of a group that had meetins at the hotel. The hotel was a nice and intimate. All around the service was good. The facilities were also good for the price. They gym was small, but had all the necessary equipment and was attached to a spa (great jacuzzi and sauna). The meeting space was clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: microsciences
Reviews.Content: The Monaco makes one feel like they've gone back in time and living a scene in a movie like the "Maltese Falcon". There's an old time elegance to it, though not in a seedy slightly rundown way. Everything is up to date, yet plush in an understated way. The staff is friendly and courteous, helpful in the extreme. There are wine and cheese get together in the late afternoon, and connected is the hotel is a French Restaurant that is a bit pricy but worth the visit. They have a sense of humor as well, as when i was there they celebrated Bastille Day in full costume. The rooms are a bit small but well furnished and there is no A/C, but its rare one needs it in SF. Being located on Geary St. has its pluses and minuses. Great Diners for breakfast and lunch, a few good restaurants, Sushi in particular and art galleries, but the street is a bit seedy. Union Sq and Market Street are a few minutes walk. I like to think of this hotel as a great place to stay in bed - preferably with someone you just met. It seems to cater to a lot of Euro travelers, but if you can't stand the thought of one more Marriott or Doubletree stay, this is a good bet

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with excellent customer care”
Reviews.Author: dangermouse17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon and stayed at the Hotel Monaco twice throughout our stay. On our first arrival the staff were friendly, polite and helpful, and made us feel welcome from the minute they helped us from the taxi. The hotel was lovely and the services provided great. The hotel manager Jason upgraded us on our second stay and left us champagne, chocolate and a lovely letter congratulating us on our wedding. They went all out to make us feel special and it worked. All the staff know you by name from the minute you walk in, they seem to love their jobs and it shows. We will definately be returning when in San Fransico again. You can join there Kimpton in touch free of charge and get internet access free during your stay. The staff will sort any problem out for you down to what type of pillows you have on your bed, to make sure your stay is comfortable. A ***** service at a fraction of the price. :o) Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Service - Great Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Salmantino6884
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Monaco during my trip to Folsom Street Fair in September 2011. This was my third or fourth time staying here as it is always consistent. Truth be told... the standard rooms here are rather small so I would suggest an upgrade. Luckily I am a Kimpton In-Touch member so typically my room is upgraded to a suite which is very accommodating (large room, enormous bathroom with tub/shower, extra seating area, two desk areas, etc...). Geary Street near Union Square is somewhat populated with many homeless but that's most of San Francisco so there's nothing you can really do about that. Fortunately, the location is walking distance to the Square and to many other tourist destinations. One drawback, however, is the difficult in finding a taxi... the bellman/valet certainly helps but there were moments when I waited +5-10 minutes because most taxis fill at the other hotels further before on the street. Overall the rooms here are nice, clean and comfortable. The restaurant is outstanding (can never understand why it isn't usually crowded) and unique. Staff is always friendly, polite and attentive. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: captainsimon
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in September with my wife who is a discerning hotel guest! So what are my thoughts : The Monaco had lovely people(the concierges are excellent and know everyone by name), we loved the happy hour at 5pm with free wine and massages, free water in the lobby and free coffee/tea in the mornings, the rooms were quiet, the gym was not bad, location is very good and the spa looked good as well. We didn't eat at the hotel so cant comment on the food. what more do you need from a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melbournetravellers
Reviews.Content: What a cute place! The decor was very art deco and had a lovely feel to it, the staff were very friendly and we even had a fish delivered to our room! Loved that as we were really missing our dogs back home, and having the little fish in our room was a nice touch! They also had complimentary wine tasting in the lounge from 5pm which was a nice way to start the evening. PERFECT location - just a short stroll to Union Square - shopping, cable car to Fishermans Wharf, and some great little bars. The bar next door was great & they have happy hour from 3pm which is ideal when on holidays! We stayed for 5 nights and found it was the perfect base for San Francisco - we were even able to walk to the Baseball stadium - probably a 30/40min walk. The rooms were really clean & we ordered room service one night which was a little on the expensive side but the food was delicious. I would stay at this hotel again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissCandDrS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on a recent California holiday and this hotel was the perfect place to spend our last few days before returning to the UK. Upon arrival our check in was quick and efficient with very friendly staff. The porter who took our bags to the room was lovely and remembered our names each time we passed him in reception. He put the bags in the room, made sure we were happy with the room (Alice in Wonderland Suite which was superb) and gave us lots of helpful information about the area. Every afternoon they offer free wine in the lounge along with free back and neck massages (although we never managed to get a massage as the queue was very long). The rooms were very, very clean and ours had a separate living area and huge bathroom. The breakfast we had paid for on top of the room was very basic though, just some fruit and either toast or a croissant so this was slightly dissappointing and the quality wasn't great. In the evening the bar was packed and the bar men were excellent and really friendly and professional, although it is quite pricey. Overall this is a great hotel. Location is perfect for all the sites in San Francisco and the customer service and amenities arenoutstanding. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the cozy queen canopy rooms -- clean, quiet and equipped with a very comfortable bed. The typical InTouch member perks (free wireless and an NYTimes at my door in the morning) make staying at a Kimpton especially enjoyable, but this one was over-the-top in terms of service. Front desk agents went out of there way to help me with brunch and dinner recommendations, transit options and to make sure that I got the room type that I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: kingsleylion
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have said that their rooms were small, I paid for a standard room and it was perfectly adequate. It was overlooking the garbage bins, but by San Francisco standards it was really really quiet. In 30 years of travelling to San Francisco i had my best two nights sleep there,ever. Every member of staff that I had contact with were delightful. I particularly enjoyed tickling Lucy, behind reception ( ok she is a pug dog ) I would stay here again in a heartbeat,loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Californian382
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is the second Kimpton hotel we've stayed in and we were very impressed by both of them. The Monaco is an old property that has been thoroughly and lovingly brought into first-class condition. Our room was a little on the small side, but perfectly adequate. The furnishings were very fine and stylish. Some of the amenities will make you smile - especially the animal print bathrobes that seem to be standard features in this chain. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The public spaces are impressive and interesting to wander through. Especially enjoyable was the hotel restaurant, which has interesting art, high ceilings, and looks like it belongs in a classy hotel in Paris or Vienna. The included breakfast was very delicious (we had the continental, but more choices were available). The location is very good, within 2 blocks of Union Square. Valet parking is the only choice if you come with a car, and it is not cheap, about the only drawback to this hotel. However, any hotel in this general area is going to have the same parking issues. In short, a thoroughly enjoyable place to stay. We will definitely return on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Summer8204
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 2 nights while in San Fran. We were greeted by wonderful hosts at the hotel, who readily volunteered to hold our luggage as we were early to check in, as well as helped direct us to great restaurants and called a shuttle to the airport upon checkout. Our room was great, yes it is a little small but really, more than enough space for us, our luggage, and to move around comfortably. The room was decorated in a very modern way, with a very large mirror and a canopy over the bed (which was very comfy). The evening hosted wine reception was amazing...they were not stingy on their pours either! (however they post there is cheese available, which I did not see!). The neighborhood is good, it is on the edge of Tenderloin, and as with any urban city there was bums in the area which were annoying but not overly aggressive. Would totally stay here again...it was a tad pricey but the best deal I could find in the Union Square area of San Fran. Also----we saw a cart being pushed to a room for room service that had a fish in a fishbowl on it....I didn't ask any questions, but thought that was pretty cool!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: mac1419
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with outstanding service. As a Kimpton In Touch member they upgraded me to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for our recent anniversay”
Reviews.Author: CunningMcFar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a Monte Carlo Suite here for our 12th wedding anniversary and could not be happier with our choice. Huge, gorgeous suite, jacuzzi tub, super comfortable bed and furnishings. Friendly and attentive service from all staff during our short stay. Bar serves up quality cocktails and is long on atmosphere, and the French offerings for Sunday brunch were quite satisfying and perfectly decadent --champagne, cocktails, oysters, mussels, escargot, charcuterie and flammekueche at 9am?!? Well done!

Reviews.Title: “5 days stay”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveller41
Reviews.Content: good location. helpful front desk. However, front desk is staffed by a single person except daytime. Very slow housekeeping service (took 3 hours to get coffee to the coffee machine (need to request one) in the room after housekeeping consistently forgot to replenish it). Room is quite small. Nice furniture and good bed. Only a single chair. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service...”
Reviews.Author: 2jjai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Monaco as part of our honeymoon travels. The hotel is located within close proximity to Union Square where we were easily able to get on a tour bus to see the sights of San Francisco and also to do some shopping. We were given a large room which was very clean. We were made to feel welcome and the staff were extremely helpful and were clued up on what to do and where to go in San Francisco. I am glad we chose to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: ScreenSydney
Reviews.Content: Great base for 4-5 days. Close to Union Square as well as good local restaurants. Yes, small bedroom reminded us more of London-type accomodation but the lounge, restaurant and bar, together with walking-distance to everything, meant we were barely in the room. Extras such as iced drinks on return from walks and the evening wine tastings (with massage if you chose) were highly welcoming. Our breakfast wasn't included in the tariff but we made sure to start each morning with the great food and service on offer each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: jtmsi
Reviews.Content: Two lifelong friends and I spent a terrific weekend at Hotel Monaco in San Francisco. The staff was uniformly friendly, helpful and interested in our comfort. The room decor is zany (reminds one of a big top in the circus) but comfortable. We loved the location: close to cozy little restaurants and Union Square shopping. As others have mentioned, the wine reception is a great way to transition from daytime activities to evening dinner. The restaurant and bar are excellent if you don't want to venture out in the evening chill, and the wait staff is very accomodating. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: pulidoc
Reviews.Content: I had read that the rooms were small, but I had a room with two beds in it on the top floor and I found it to be roomy by San Francisco standards. The room was decorated quite nicely and the beds were wonderfully soft. They have a happy hour from 5:00 to 6:00 every day with a nice variety of wines and they are not stingy. The staff was incredibly friendly and the hotel spotlessly clean. It is two blocks from Union Square and very convienent. I would definately stay here again. My mother was able to get the senior rate so it was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Sue-Laurence B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, outstanding staff. Made us feel at home right from day 1. the concerige staff, wonderful. Clean, quiet (except for the early morning garbage pick up in the alley), everything a guest would want. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “If able to get a good rate, this can be a good choice”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: My room was very small - fortunately, by myself so it was ok. While the hotel is close to Union Square & Nob HIll, it is also close to the Tenderloin. It is a perfectly safe location - just be aware of directions. The highlight of my stay was the evening wine reception - in addition to drinks & some food, enjoyed chatting with other guests. Service was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: darkwaters
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in a Kimpton Hotel and I enjoyed the experience each time. Terrific wine and cheese at night, cozy rooms and pet friendly! Staff are knowledgeable and are happy to help. Provided insight on restaurants and places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - Small room (at least ours)”
Reviews.Author: TeteJose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice. Rooms are fashion-decorated. Ours, however, was quite narrow so we only have one bedside table, which is a litte inconvenient. It is very well located, close to Union Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it-”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaFenwayI30
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. It was really cute. I was given an upgrade to one of the suites and that was really wonderful, I loved the large jacuzzi, and the soft comfortable couch. I also ate at the Grand Cafe next door and the Mason Cafe around the block and both restaurants were incredible. The location is great, walking distances to the Moscone (about 10 minutes) and tons of nearby shopping, bars, restaurants.... Christine- the front desk manager was very helpful with helping me with my logistics. The entire staff was friendly and polite. I can't wait to continue staying at Kimpton Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - missed the Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Lexie41
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with comfortable but small rooms. Checkin was fast and efficient. Bed was great. Happy hour in the lounge was a good value. The 'other' happy hour with complimentary wine and a few bites was also a plus. What we missed was a Concierge to answer questions. We arrived Wednesday and didn't see one until Saturday morning. No excuse - just she was off for two days. Not sure this is excusable in a four star hotel. We like animals, but not at the front door, behind the counter or in the wine room mingling with guests. Also, if you are looking for a reasonably priced breakfast, please check elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but if you have bad animal allergies this hotel is not for you”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend who was in from out of town after a day of shopping around the union square area. This is a nice hotel, and like all the reviews state, it is in a good central location to all the shopping and theater. The staff is very polite and accommodating. Our valet parking was quick and efficient as was check in and check out. Definitely 5* service. I have stayed at 5* hotels (ie Ritz's, Fairmonts, Four Seasons etc.) where the service has not been this good. If you like older, elaborate, quirky decor, this hotel is for you.
